title: Ruth Lloyd-Harlins New Book Into Each Life Tears Must Fall is an in Depth and Personal Look into the Case of Eddie Joe Lloyd, Michigans First DNA Exonoree.
text:
Recent release “Into Each Life Tears Must Fall” from Page Publishing author Ruth Lloyd-Harlin is a view into one of America’s most infamous cases of wrongful conviction that exposed the failings of the United States criminal justice system.
(PRWEB) October 06, 2015
Ruth Lloyd-Harlin, a retired Highland Park School District employee, has completed her new book “Into Each Life Tears Must Fall”: a very real and detailed description of events that occurred during and after the conviction of Eddie Joe Lloyd, who served 17 years of a life sentence handed down for a crime he did not commit.
Lloyd-Harlin was inspired to write this story on behalf of her brother, Eddie Joe Lloyd. She says, “The truth always rises to the surface. If one has faith and hope they can conquer any situation, even if it seems impossible.”
Published by New York City-based Page Publishing, Ruth Lloyd-Harlin’s fascinating tale tells the compelling life story of Eddie Joe Lloyd, retelling his early years from his first crime at the age nine, to his downward spiral as a petty criminal and drug addicted before he reached twenty, to the events that occurred during and after his seventeen-year incarceration.
This book is a scrutiny of one of the most famous cases of wrongful conviction, and how Eddie persevered and brought to light the shortcomings of the United States criminal justice system.
Readers who wish to experience this gripping work can purchase “Into Every Life Tears Must Fall” at bookstores everywhere, or online at the Apple iTunes store, Amazon, Google Play or Barnes and Noble.
For additional information or media inquiries, contact Page Publishing at 866-315-2708.
